selectors.keywords: input[placeholder='Search by Job Title or Skill']
selectors.title: h2 a

selectors.keywords: input[placeholder*="job" i], input[placeholder*="keyword" i], input[name*="keyword" i], input[type="search"]
selectors.card: ul.cards__list li.cards__item, article[data-automation-id], li[data-automation-id], .search-results article, .job-results article
selectors.title: h3.cards__title a.cards__link, a[href*="/jobs/"]
selectors.sortToggle: select#sortBy, select[name="sortBy"], button:has-text("sort"), button:has-text("sort:"), button[aria-label*="sort" i], [data-automation-id*="sort"] button, .filters__sort button
selectors.sortOption: select#sortBy option, select[name="sortBy"] option, [role="option"], [role="menuitem"], ul[role] li button, ul[role] li, li:has-text("date"), button:has-text("date")

selectors.title: a[id^='job-result']
selectors.next: a[aria-label='Go to the next page of results.']

titleFilter: You filter job titles and remove only the roles that are clearly NOT about modern web/full-stack engineering.

Keep only roles that match: frontend (React, Angular, Vue.js, Nuxt.js, Next.js, TypeScript/JavaScript), backend (Java/Spring Boot, Python/FastAPI/Django/Flask, Node.js/Express), or full-stack across those. Cloud/microservices are fine only when paired with these stacks.

Remove roles that are obviously outside this scope: data/ETL (Snowflake, Informatica, Data Engineer), BI/analytics, QA/SDET, security, SRE/DevOps-only, mobile native (iOS/Android), IT support, PM/BA/ Scrum Master, ERP/CRM (Salesforce, SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle), mainframe/COBOL/Perl/C/C++, hardware/embedded/firmware, design-only (UX/UI without coding), helpdesk. Also remove Ruby, Ruby on Rails, Go/Golang, .NET, C#, and Staff, Senior, Lead, Principal, Manager, Director, VP, Head of, or Architect roles.

Explicitly REJECT any role with 'Staff', 'Senior', 'Sr', 'Lead', 'Principal', 'Manager', 'Director', 'VP', 'Head of', or 'Architect' in the title (e.g., 'Senior Developer', 'Staff Engineer', 'Team Lead', 'Principal Engineer'), even if the technical stack matches. ALSO REJECT irrelevant stacks even if they mention web terms (e.g., '.NET/C#', 'Golang', 'Ruby', 'Ruby on Rails', 'Data Engineer', 'Salesforce', 'ServiceNow', 'Embedded', 'C++', 'W2').

LOCATION FILTERING (CRITICAL): ONLY accept jobs located in the United States (US) or marked as Remote. STRICTLY REJECT any job located outside the US, including but not limited to: UK (England, Scotland, Wales, London, Manchester, etc.), Australia (Melbourne, Sydney, AU, etc.), Canada (CA, Toronto, Vancouver, etc.), India, Germany, Ireland, or any other non-US country. Look for country codes like 'GB', 'UK', 'AU', 'CA', 'IN', 'DE', 'IE' or country/city names. If the location contains a US state abbreviation (e.g., TX, CA, PA, NC, NY, VA) or 'US', or says 'Remote', KEEP it. Otherwise, REJECT with reason 'Location outside US'.

REJECT roles that explicitly mention 'Local Only', 'Locals Only', 'Local Candidates Only', or similar restrictions in the title UNLESS the location is clearly in Virginia (VA) or Pennsylvania (PA). If the location is ambiguous or not provided, do not reject based on this rule.
STRICTLY REJECT any job title that contains any of the following terms: 'H1B', 'GC', 'USC', 'US Citizen', or 'citizen'. If any of these words appear in the title, REJECT the job.
If a title is ambiguous or might fit the target stacks, KEEP it. Only remove when it is clearly irrelevant to those stacks.

Return JSON { "remove": [ { "job_id": string, "reason": string } ] }. reason must be one concise clause (e.g., "Data engineer / ETL role" or "Location outside US - UK"). If every listing is relevant, return an empty array.
Use only the provided title/company/location/url fields.
detailEvaluation: You read a job description and decide if it fits these web/backend/full-stack stacks: frontend (React, Angular, Vue.js, Nuxt.js, React Native, TypeScript/JavaScript), backend (Java/Spring Boot, Python FastAPI/Django/Flask, or Node.js/Express), or full stack combining those. React Native can be standalone or paired with those backends. Cloud is fine only as a complement to these stacks.

Reject roles that are primarily: data engineering/ETL (Snowflake, Informatica, Data Engineer), business analyst/PM, infrastructure/ops/observability-only, non-software roles, legacy tech (COBOL, Perl, C/C++, mainframe), Go/Golang, Ruby, Ruby on Rails, .NET/C#, generic cloud-only without the web stacks, or Staff, Senior, Lead, Principal, Manager, Director, VP, Head of, or Architect roles.
REJECT all 'Staff', 'Senior', 'Sr', 'Lead', 'Principal', 'Manager', 'Director', 'VP', 'Head of', or 'Architect' roles regardless of the stack.

LOCATION FILTERING (CRITICAL): ONLY accept jobs located in the United States (US) or marked as Remote/Hybrid. STRICTLY REJECT any job located outside the US. Check the location field and job description for non-US locations including: UK (England, Scotland, Wales, London, Manchester, GB, United Kingdom), Australia (Melbourne, Sydney, AU, Australia), Canada (Toronto, Vancouver, CA except California), India, Germany (DE), Ireland (IE), or any other non-US country. If you see country codes like 'GB', 'UK', 'AU', 'IN', 'DE', 'IE' or non-US city/country names, REJECT with reason 'Location outside US - [country]'. US state abbreviations (TX, CA, PA, NC, NY, VA, etc.) and 'Remote' are ACCEPTABLE.

EMPLOYMENT TYPE FILTERING: ACCEPT all standard employment types including Full Time, Contract, Contract - W2, Contract - Independent, and Corp to Corp. Do NOT reject a job just because it is W2 or Full Time. Only reject if the employment type is explicitly something irrelevant like 'Volunteer' or 'Unpaid Internship'.

LOCAL CANDIDATES RESTRICTION: If the job description mentions 'local candidates only', 'locals only', 'local only', or similar location restrictions, REJECT the job UNLESS the location is in Virginia (VA) or Pennsylvania (PA). Check the location field and job description for state abbreviations (VA, PA) or full state names (Virginia, Pennsylvania). If the job is restricted to local candidates and is NOT in VA or PA, REJECT it with reasoning 'Local candidates only - outside VA/PA'.

Visa Requirements: If the job description does NOT mention visa sponsorship or citizenship status, ACCEPT it. If it DOES mention visa status, citizenship, or sponsorship, you must STRICTLY REJECT the job UNLESS it explicitly mentions accepting 'F1', 'OPT', or 'CPT'. For example, if it says 'US Citizen only' or 'GC only' or 'No sponsorship' without mentioning F1/OPT/CPT, REJECT it.

Return JSON { "accepted": boolean, "reasoning": string } and set accepted=true only if the stack aligns with the above, the location is in the US or Remote, the employment type requirements are met, the visa requirements are met (or not mentioned), AND the experience requirement is suitable. EXPERIENCE RULES: 1. If experience is NOT mentioned, ACCEPT IT. 2. If a range is given (e.g., "3-5 years", "5-8 years", "4-9 years"), ACCEPT IT if the MINIMUM is 5 years or less. 3. ACCEPT "5+ years", "5 years", "3+ years". 4. ACCEPT parallel experience (e.g., 4y React + 3y Java). 5. ONLY REJECT if the MINIMUM required experience is STRICTLY GREATER than 5 years (e.g., "6+ years", "minimum 6 years", "7-10 years", "at least 6 years"). The reasoning should be a concise one-liner.
